sen.j: 御香宮神社（ごこうぐうじんじゃ、ごこうのみやじんじゃ）は京都市伏見区にある神社である。
sen.e: Gokogu-jinja Shrine (or Gokonomiya-jinja Shrine) is a Shinto shrine located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
Gokogu-jinja Shrine (or Gokonomiya-jinja Shrine) is a Shinto shrine located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
Gokogu-jinja Shrine (it is also pronounced Gokonomiya-jinja Shrine) is a Shinto shrine located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 旧社格は府社。
sen.e: It was ranked as a Fusha under the old shrine classification system.
It was ranked as a Fusha under the old shrine classification system.
It was ranked as a Fusha (prefectural shrine) under the old shrine classification system.

sen.j: 通称御香宮、御幸宮。
sen.e: The shrine is commonly known "Gokonomiya.".
The shrine is commonly known "Gokonomiya.".
The shrine is commonly known Gokonomiya.

sen.j: 伏見地区の産土神である。
sen.e: It is the local shrine of the Fushimi area.
It is the local shrine of the Fushimi area.
It is the local shrine of the Fushimi area.

sen.j: 神功皇后を主祭神とし、夫の仲哀天皇、子の応神天皇ほか六神を祀る。
sen.e: The main deity is Empress Shinko who is enshrined alongside her husband, Emperor Chuai, and her son, Emperor Ojin.
The main deity is Empress Shinko who is enshrined alongside her husband, Emperor Chuai, and her son, Emperor Ojin.
The main deity is the Empress Shinko who is enshrined alongside her husband, the Emperor Chuai, and her son, the Emperor Ojin.

sen.j: 神功皇后の神話における伝承から、安産の神として信仰を集める。
sen.e: Legend has it that Empress Shinko is the goddess of smooth childbirth.
Legend has it that Empress Shinko is the goddess of smooth childbirth.
Legend has it that Empress Shinko is the goddess of smooth childbirth.

sen.j: また社務所内に小堀遠州が伏見奉行所内に作ったとされる庭園が移設されている。
sen.e: At the shrine office is a garden that is thought to have originally been that created by Enshu KOBORI at the Fushimi magistrate's office and relocated to its current site.
At the shrine office is a garden that is thought to have originally been that created by Enshu KOBORI at the Fushimi magistrate's office and relocated to its current site.
At the shrine office is a garden that is thought to have originally been that created by Enshu KOBORI at the Fushimi magistrate's office and relocated to its current site.

sen.j: 創建の由緒は不詳であるが、貞観 (日本)4年（862年）に社殿を修造した記録がある。
sen.e: The circumstances of the shrine's founding are unclear but there are records of the shrine buildings being renovated in the year 862.
The circumstances of the shrine's founding are unclear but there are records of the shrine buildings being renovated in the year 862.
The circumstances of the shrine's founding are unclear but there are records of the shrine buildings being renovated in the year 862.

sen.j: 伝承によると、この年、境内より良い香りの水が湧き出し、その水を飲むと病が治ったので、時の清和天皇から「御香宮」の名を賜ったという。
sen.e: According to legend, it was in this year that a fragrant spring gushed from the shrine grounds and that drinking the water could cure diseases, which led Emperor Seiwa to grant the shrine the name "Gokogu" (lit. Fragrant Shrine).

According to legend, it was in this year that a fragrant spring gushed from the shrine grounds and that drinking the water could cure diseases, which led Emperor Seiwa to grant the shrine the name "Gokogu" (lit. Fragrant Shrine).

According to legend, it was in this year that a fragrant spring gushed from the shrine grounds and that drinking the water could cure diseases, which led the Emperor Seiwa to grant the shrine the name 'Gokogu' (lit. Fragrant Shrine).

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉は、伏見城築城の際に当社を城内に移し、鬼門の守護神とした。
sen.e: When Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI finished constructing Fushimi Casle, he moved the shrine onto the castle grounds to serve as a guardian shrine.
When Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI finished constructing Fushimi Casle, he moved the shrine onto the castle grounds to serve as a guardian shrine.
When Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI finished constructing Fushimi-jo Castle, he moved the shrine onto the castle grounds to serve as a guardian shrine.

sen.j: 後に徳川家康によって元の位置に戻され、本殿が造営された。
sen.e: It was later returned to its original site by Ieyasu TOKUGAWa who also built the main hall.
It was later returned to its original site by Ieyasu TOKUGAWa who also built the main hall.
It was later returned to its original site by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who also built the main hall.

sen.j: 表門は伏見城の大手門を移築したものとされている。
sen.e: The Omote-mon gate is believed to have originally been the Ote-mon gate that stood at Fushimi Castle.
The Omote-mon gate is believed to have originally been the Ote-mon gate that stood at Fushimi Castle.
The Omote-mon gate is believed to have originally been the Ote-mon gate that stood at Fushimi-jo Castle.

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）に起こった鳥羽伏見の戦いでは伏見町内における官軍（薩摩藩）の本営となったが、本殿等は無事であった。
sen.e: During the Battle of Toba Fushimi in 1868, the shrine served as the imperial army (Satsuma Domain) headquarters in Fushimi-cho but the shrine buildings were undamaged.
During the Battle of Toba Fushimi in 1868, the shrine served as the imperial army (Satsuma Domain) headquarters in Fushimi-cho but the shrine buildings were undamaged.
During the Battle of Toba Fushimi in 1868, the shrine served as the imperial army (Satsuma Domain) headquarters in Fushimi-cho but the shrine buildings were undamaged.

sen.j: 昭和に入ってからはすぐ東を通る国道24号の拡幅に伴い、境内の一部を道路用地として提供した。
sen.e: In the Showa era, part of the shrine precinct was turned over to the construction of National Highway 24.
In the Showa era, part of the shrine precinct was turned over to the construction of National Highway 24.
In the Showa period, part of the shrine precinct was turned over to the widening construction of National Highway 24 which is running right east of the temple.
sen.cmt: 時代用語統一文章を原文にあわせて補足しました。

sen.j: 神社の名前の由来となった湧水は、石井の御香水と呼ばれ多くの人々に崇敬を集めていたが、明治時代に一度涸れてしまった。
sen.e: The spring, known as "Ishii-no-Gokosui", from which the name of the shrine is derived, dried up during the Meiji era.
The spring, known as "Ishii-no-Gokosui", from which the name of the shrine is derived, dried up during the Meiji era.
Although the spring, known as Ishii-no-Gokosui, from which the name of the shrine is derived, was venerated by many people, it dried up during the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 時代用語統一文章を原文にあわせて補足しました。

sen.j: そのため1982年の春に別の場所を掘り下げて復元された。
sen.e: In spring of 1982, the spring was restored when it was excavated from a different location.
In spring of 1982, the spring was restored when it was excavated from a different location.
In spring of 1982, the spring was restored when it was excavated from a different location.

sen.j: その後1985年に環境省の名水百選に認定されている。
sen.e: In 1985 it was certified one of the 100 greatest springs by the Ministry of the Environment.
In 1985 it was certified one of the 100 greatest springs by the Ministry of the Environment.
In 1985 it was certified one of the 100 greatest springs by the Ministry of the Environment.

sen.j: また伏見の地場産業である日本酒と関連が深い。
sen.e: It is also deeply related to the local Fushimi industry of rice wine production.
It is also deeply related to the local Fushimi industry of rice wine production.
It is also deeply related to the local Fushimi industry of rice wine production.

sen.j: 重要文化財
sen.e: Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties

sen.j: 本殿 徳川家康の命令で建立 平成2年（1990年）の修理で、極彩色の彫刻が復元された
sen.e: Main hall: Constructed by the order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and repaired in 1990 when its richly colored carvings were restored
Main hall: Constructed by the order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and repaired in 1990 when its richly colored carvings were restored
Main hall: Constructed by the order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and repaired in 1990 when its richly colored carvings were restored

sen.j: 拝殿 寛永2年（1625年）徳川頼宣の寄進によって建立による割拝殿の構造となっている建物 中国の登龍門の故事に基づいた極彩色彫刻が唐破風元にある
sen.e: Worship hall: This divided worship hall was constructed in 1625 using funds donated by Yorinobe TOKUGAWA and the richly colored carvings on the undulating bargeboard are based on the Chinese legend of a carp passing through a gate to become a dragon

Worship hall: This divided worship hall was constructed in 1625 using funds donated by Yorinobe TOKUGAWA and the richly colored carvings on the undulating bargeboard are based on the Chinese legend of a carp passing through a gate to become a dragon

Worship hall: This divided worship hall was constructed in 1625 using funds donated by Yorinobe TOKUGAWA and the richly colored carvings on the undulating bargeboard are based on the Chinese legend of a carp passing through a gate to become a dragon

sen.j: 表門（旧伏見城大手門）元和 (日本)8年（1622年）徳川頼房の寄進によって建立 中国の二十四孝の蟇股がある
sen.e: Omote-mon gate (formerly the Ote-mon gate of Fushimi Castle): Constructed in 1622 using funds donated by Yoifusa TOKUGAWA and has frog-leg struts representing the Chinese Twenty-four Filial Exemplars
Omote-mon gate (formerly the Ote-mon gate of Fushimi Castle): Constructed in 1622 using funds donated by Yoifusa TOKUGAWA and has frog-leg struts representing the Chinese Twenty-four Filial Exemplars

Omote-mon gate (formerly the Ote-mon gate of Fushimi-jo Castle): Constructed in 1622 using funds donated by Yorifusa TOKUGAWA and has frog-leg struts representing the Chinese Twenty-four Filial Exemplars

sen.j: 金熨斗付太刀（きんのしつきたち）備前長光が作ったとされる
sen.e: Tachi sword decorated with a gold paste: Believed to have been forged by Nagamitsu BIZEN
Tachi sword decorated with a gold paste: Believed to have been forged by Nagamitsu BIZEN
Tachi sword decorated with a gold paste: Believed to have been forged by Nagamitsu BIZEN

sen.e: Other
Other

sen.j: 算額 文久3年（1863年） 西岡天極斎奉納 絵馬堂に掲額
sen.e: Wooden mathematical puzzle tablet: Dedicated by Tengyokusai NISHIOKA in 1863 and kept in the Ema-do hall.
Wooden mathematical puzzle tablet: Dedicated by Tengyokusai NISHIOKA in 1863 and kept in the Ema-do hall.
Wooden mathematical puzzle tablet: Dedicated by Tengyokusai NISHIOKA in 1863 and kept in the Ema-do hall.

sen.j: 算額 天和 (日本)3年（1683年） 山本宗信奉納（復元） 絵馬堂に掲額 八坂神社に答えの算額がある
sen.e: Wooden mathematical puzzle tablet: Dedicated by Munenobu YAMAMOTO in 1683 and kept in the Ema-do hall, with the tablet containing the solution kept at Yasaka-jinja Shrine.
Wooden mathematical puzzle tablet: Dedicated by Munenobu YAMAMOTO in 1683 and kept in the Ema-do hall, with the tablet containing the solution kept at Yasaka-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 近鉄桃山御陵前駅、京阪伏見桃山駅、JR奈良線桃山駅より徒歩
sen.e: Walk from Kintetsu Momoyamagoryo-mae Station, Keihan Fushimi Momoyama Station or JR Nara Line Momoyama Station.
Walk from Kintetsu Momoyamagoryo-mae Station, Keihan Fushimi Momoyama Station or JR Nara Line Momoyama Station.
Walk from Kintetsu Momoyamagoryo-mae Station, Keihan Fushimi Momoyama Station or JR Nara Line Momoyama Station.

sen.j: 京都市営バス御香宮前 バス停
sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Bus to "Gokogu-mae" bus stop.
